message: sales number going down, sir? i'd stop pushing it on the same group again and again ;) personally, my distraction isn't on the desktop... it's internet in general; twitter, and more recently, convore...
Good point, but some times people have documents the really want to keep for easy access. BTW, why are you up at like 2:30AM?

@kirillzubovsky ah, it sounded great then I noticed it costs money. As much as I respect the fact it takes time, effort and resources to make the app, it just doesn't feel like I'd be willing to pay for such a simple application.
@awfy that's fine, this is for the folks who are ;)
@ahonorstudent I could fall asleep :) and I agree different people have different needs. This is not all fits all, just a one simple solution for ppl with one simple problem.
@unwrangle yup, possibly. Also I find concord a little overwhelming, so apologies for the same group, didn't notice.
@kirillzubovsky I think you would do better by making it free then capitalising on popularity.
@unwrangle how do you envision me making money on "popularity"?
@kirillzubovsky it was @awfy, but if i may, there're plenty of businesses are banking on find user base first, then figure out business model later. examples: facebook, twitter, and of course google
personally though, if you don't want to make your app free, don't. feel free to experiment, but make sure you're happy with your decision. no regrets.

@unwrangle - I completely agree with the latter, and that's what I was going for. Also, I tried twice to reply @awfy (from @convore mobile app for iPhone) but for some reason ... well, you could see what happened. Thanks guys! I definitely appreciate the input, even if we don't agree on all points.
sorry I am getting into this convo pretty late
convore's alright. my startup is considering switching from fb groups
